roadmap.purpose: Contributor coordination roadmap based on repository state

milestones.title: Stabilize Core & Storage APIs
milestones.problem: Core execution and storage layers lack error handling, recovery mechanisms, and clear API contracts. This blocks contributors from building features on unstable foundations.
coordination_focus: Define exception hierarchy for task execution failures
Add state validation to storage (e.g., duplicate task prevention)
Establish API documentation for core.run() and storage functions
Expand test coverage for edge cases (empty task lists, null values, exceptions)
milestones.contributor_type: suitable for first-time contributors with review
parallel_work: Can proceed in parallel with CLI commands milestone
milestones.rationale: Both core.py and storage.py are minimal stubs. Current test coverage is basic. Stabilizing these is prerequisite for parallel execution and experimental features.

milestones.title: Implement Comprehensive CLI Interface
milestones.problem: CLI is incomplete (cli.py only has stub implementation), leaving users unable to interact with TaskFlow from the command line. This coordination gap prevents end-to-end workflow support.
coordination_focus: Design CLI command structure (e.g., run, list, save, load, delete)
Map CLI commands to core.py and storage.py functions
Add argument parsing and validation
Ensure error messages guide users toward solutions
Create usage examples in README.md
milestones.contributor_type: suitable for first-time contributors with testing support
milestones.rationale: Cannot fully implement until core.run() and storage layer have stable APIs from milestone-1. CLI design should reflect actual API capabilities.

milestones.title: Promote Experimental DAG & Scheduler to Stable
milestones.problem: DAG and Scheduler modules are experimental (taskflow/experimental/) with incomplete implementations and undocumented APIs. This uncertainty blocks adoption and contribution of parallel execution features.
coordination_focus: Complete DAG class with node/edge management and cycle detection
Complete scheduler.schedule() with task dependency resolution
Add docstrings explaining API contracts and limitations
Create tests demonstrating DAG construction and parallel execution
Update TODO.md with promotion criteria or move to stable taskflow/ directory
Document breaking changes (if any) from sequential execution
milestones.contributor_type: requires maintainer involvement for architecture decisions
milestones.rationale: Experimental modules block parallel execution work. Promotion requires architectural decisions about how DAGs integrate with core.run(), which maintainers must guide.

milestones.title: Enhance Test Coverage & Add Integration Tests
milestones.problem: Current tests (test_core.py, test_storage.py) cover happy paths only. Missing integration tests, error cases, and cross-module interactions. This coordination gap prevents confident refactoring and feature development.

gaps: No integration tests between core and storage

coordination_focus: Add error case tests: empty task lists, failing tasks, null inputs
Add integration tests: core -> storage workflows
Add parameterized tests for different task types
Create fixtures for common test scenarios
Document test strategy in TODO.md or separate TESTING.md
blocking_milestones: milestone-1 (needs stable APIs to test against)
parallel_work: Can proceed independently after milestone-1 is defined
milestones.rationale: Better test coverage unblocks confidence in refactoring storage and core. First-time contributors can add tests with clear acceptance criteria.

milestones.title: Coordinate Module Documentation & API Reference
milestones.problem: Missing public API documentation, no examples of task definition or integration patterns, unclear stability of features. This coordination failure prevents new contributors from understanding contribution boundaries.

documentation_gaps: taskflow/__init__.py: empty, no public API exports
No docstrings in core.py, storage.py, cli.py

coordination_focus: Add function docstrings (parameters, return types, exceptions) to all public APIs
Create CONTRIBUTING.md with contribution workflow and review process
Add examples to README.md: basic task definition, storage usage, CLI examples
Define public API surface in taskflow/__init__.py
Create unstable/experimental feature notice in README.md
Update TODO.md with issue references and status tracking
milestones.contributor_type: suitable for first-time contributors and technical writers
parallel_work: Can start immediately for README examples
Docstrings should begin after milestone-1 APIs are stable
milestones.rationale: Documentation does not require code changes, but unblocks other milestones by clarifying expectations. Can proceed in parallel with milestone-1 for planning.

dependency_graph.summary: Three work streams with controlled blocking relationships
parallel_streams: milestone-1 and milestone-2 can start simultaneously if core.py interface is negotiated upfront

first_time_contributors: milestone-4: Add test cases for error handling (clear acceptance criteria)
milestone-5: Improve README examples (no code changes required)
milestone-1: Error handling improvements with guidance
maintainer_decisions_required: milestone-3: DAG promotion and parallel execution architecture
milestone-1: API stability guarantees and versioning strategy
milestone-5: Public API surface and stability guarantees
